text:
Pt. admitted this a.m. to MICU service from [**Hospital Ward Name 790**] 3 with hemoptysis and
   hypoxia.  He was admitted on [**1-7**] with CHF and MSSA endocarditis,
   being treated with diuretics and antibiotics.  Pt. developed a lower
   body rash (?vasculitis) after receiving nafcillin and had torsades
   after receiving moxycillin.  Other complications on the floor include
   heart block for which he has a temporary wire (via brachial)/external
   pacemaker, worsening renal failure with poor response to diuretics, and
   epistaxis for which ENT packed nares with dissolving packing.
   Early this a.m. pt. developed hemoptysis, shortness of breath and
   hypoxia.  Pt. transferred to CCU.  Pt. was on heparin drip on the
   floor, d/c
d at 0650 this a.m.
   EVENTS:
   Pt. intubated
   Aline placed
   HD catheter placed
   Pt. bronched
   Transfused 2 units FFP
   CVVHDF started
   Pt. being followed closely by MICU, renal, hematology, rheumetology,
   ID, and cardiology.
   Hemoptysis
   Assessment:
   Received pt. in moderate respiratory distress with diffuse crackles
   throughout.  Pt. required 100% NR + 4L NC to maintain sats in low to
   mid 90
s.  Pt. expectorating copious amounts of frank red blood.  Pt.
   was on a lasix gtt on floor with marginal response.  LE edema as noted.
    VSS.  Skin warm, dry.
   Action:
   -Pt. intubated and sedated.  Sedation increased as noted for
   dyssynchrony with ventilator.
   -Suctioned for copious bloody secretions as documented.
   -Bronchoscopy with BAL done.
   -ABG
s drawn, vent setting adjusted accordingly.
   -IV antibiotics per team for nosocomial pna.
   -5mg IV vitamin K, 28mcg desmopressin, and 2 units FFP given today.
   -Neo gtt started for hypotension with increasing dose of sedatives.
   Response:
   -Bronch consistent with alveolar hemorrhage.
   -LS less moist/wet sounding this eve.
   -Pt. synchronous with vent on 200mcg fentanyl and 6mg midaz.
   -ABG
s improved with vent changes, but cont
s to have resp. acidosis.
   -Decreased amount secretions noted this eve, remain bloody but scant.
   -BP/hemodynamics stable at present.
   Plan:
   Continue close pulmonary monitoring, follow ABG
s, coag
s, cont.
   present medication regimen, wean FiO2/vent support as tolerated.
   **Pt. will need 2 units PRBC
s tonight.
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Creat 3.4 this a.m.  (baseline 1++).  Pt. with very poor response to
   diuretics; fluid overload a concern for exacerbating pulmonary
   edeam/hemorrhage.
   Action:
   CVVHDF started this eve as documented after baseline labs drawn.
   Response:
   Pending; pt. remains hemodynamically stable, but first hour ran even.
   Plan:
   Continue present therapy per policy and per renal orders.  ** ABG
s and
   lytes due at midnight.
